Introduction:
Welcome to the first week of the course "Developing Creativity: A 6-Week Program." This course is designed to help you develop your creativity, imagination, and brainstorming skills. We'll be exploring the theories and principles of creativity, as well as providing practical exercises and techniques to help you unleash your creative potential.

Overview of Creativity, Imagination, and Brainstorming:
Creativity is the ability to come up with new ideas and solutions to problems. Imagination is the ability to visualize and form mental images in your mind. Brainstorming is the process of generating ideas and solutions through group discussions and collaboration. These three skills are closely related and work together to help you tap into your full creative potential.

Understanding the Connection between Creativity and Spirituality:
Napoleon Hill, author of "Think and Grow Rich," believed that creativity and spirituality are closely connected. He believed that the creative imagination is a direct line of communication between the finite mind of man and Infinite Intelligence. Dr. John Demartini, founder of the Demartini Institute, also recognizes the connection between spirituality and creativity, stating that creativity is a manifestation of our divine nature.

Developing a Positive Mindset:
A positive mindset is key to unlocking your creative potential. This week, we'll explore the power of positive thinking and the impact it can have on your creativity. You'll learn how to cultivate a positive mindset by focusing on gratitude, kindness, and forgiveness.

Setting a Creative Intent:
Setting a creative intent is a powerful tool to help you focus your creative energy and bring your ideas to life. This week, we'll discuss the importance of setting a creative intent and provide you with techniques to help you do so.

Self-Prompting Questions:
Self-prompting questions are a powerful tool for unlocking your creativity and generating new ideas. This week, we'll provide you with a list of self-prompting questions to help you get started.

Application Formula:
The application formula for this week is simple:

1. Practice gratitude and kindness every day.
2. Set a creative intent every morning.
3. Use self-prompting questions to generate new ideas and solutions.

By following this formula, you'll be well on your way to developing a positive mindset, unlocking your creative potential, and discovering new solutions to the challenges you face.
